publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5742 Dr Richard Simpson: Protocol for Managing Legal Cases Involving Epilepsy—That the Parliament notes that the current test for determining fitness to plead dates from 1836 and the current rules for determining legal insanity date from 1842; therefore welcomes the Law Commission for England and Wales’s decision to examine this aspect of the law in 2010, and would welcome an examination of the current application of this aspect of the law in Scotland to people with epilepsy who, while in a seizure or post-seizure state, may contribute to behaviour that is considered an offence.

S3M-5742 Dr Richard Simpson: Protocol for Managing Legal Cases Involving Epilepsy—That the Parliament notes that the current test for determining fitness to plead dates from 1836 and the current rules for determining legal insanity date from 1842; therefore welcomes the Law Commission for England and Wales’s decision to examine this aspect of the law in 2010, and would welcome an examination of the current application of this aspect of the law in Scotland to people with epilepsy who, while in a seizure or post-seizure state, may display behaviour that is considered an offence.
